thread.title: John Pope's 'Getting Off at Elysian Fields' brings obituaries to life at booksigning
thread.title_full: John Pope's 'Getting Off at Elysian Fields' brings obituaries to life at booksigning | NOLA.com

author: Sue Strachan, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: John Pope's 'Getting Off at Elysian Fields' brings obituaries to life at booksigning
text:
Al Copeland, Ruthie the Duck Girl, Jim Garrison and Mickey Easterling all have one thing in common: They have had their obituary written by NOLA.com |The Times-Picayune contributor John Pope.
"Getting Off at Elysian Fields: Obituaries from the New Orleans Times-Picayune" (University Press of Mississippi) is a compilation obituaries about New Orleanians as diverse as the city -- philanthropist, costumer, Mardi Gras Indian Big Chief, and Carnival monarch are among those who received Pope's erudite panache.
On Tuesday (Oct. 20), Commander's Palace, which happens to be located across the street from Lafayette Cemetery No. 2, was the scene of a booksigning hosted by Pope and the restaurant's Ti Martin. A who's who of friends and fans came to hear Pope read and sign books, as well as enjoy hors d'oeuvres and wine
Future booksignings are: Saturday (Oct. 24), 2 p.m., Tharp-Sontheimer-Tharp Funeral Home; Saturday, Oct. 31, 12:30 p.m., Louisiana Book Festival, Baton Rouge; and Sunday, Nov. 1, Jacob Schoen & Son Funeral Home, 4 p.m.
Read more about Pope's book : Obituary writer John Pope reads from his book 'Getting Off at Elysian Fields'
